name: Bad_Example_Autoformatting_01
content:
## Example of poorly written code -> results of autoformatting applied

## select all (ctrl/cmd + A)
##
## fix indentation: press the RStudio short cut ctrl/cmd + I
##
## fix spacing, etc.: press the RStudio short cut ctrl/cmd + shift + I

## Note that this still does not fix everything, e.g. 
## * mixing lower case and upper case is still present (e.g. "X1" and "x2"), 
## * no comments are present
## * naming of objects
## * equal signs and assignment operator used badly
## *


data <- read.csv("some_data.csv", header = TRUE)
X1 = mean(data$Column1)
x2 = median(data$Column2)
Z3 = data$Column3 * 2
if (X1 > x2) {
  print(paste("X1 is greater than X2", "Value of X1 is", X1))
  sum1 = sum(data$Column1)
  sUm2 = 0
  for (i in 1:length(data$Column2)) {
    sUm2 = sUm2 + data$Column2[i]
  }
  print(paste("Sum of column 1:", sum1))
  print(paste("Sum of column 2:", sUm2))
} else if (X1 < x2) {
  print("X1 is smaller than X2")
} else{
  print(paste ("X1 and X2 are equal"))
}

for (i in 1:length(data$Column1)) {
  if (data$Column1[i] > x2) {
    data$Column1[i] = NA
  } else{
    data$Column1[i] = data$Column1[i] + x2
  }
}
Data_1 = data[order(data$Column1), ]
rownames(Data_1) <- NULL
pLoT = function(D1) {
  plot(D1$Column1,
       D1$Column2,
       type = "b",
       col = "blue")
  title("Scatter Plot")
}
plotdata <- Data_1
pLoT(plotdata)
write.csv(Data_1, file = "output.csv", row.names = FALSE)

rm(data)
rm(plotdata)
rm(x2)
rm(X1)
rm(Z3)
rm(sum1)
rm(sUm2)
